title: WebR: Why, What, How

What is WebR?

Please enable JavaScript to experience the dynamic code cell content on this page.

title: WebR: Why, What, How
text:
Why WebR?

Education
Internal Websites
Give other people a chance with data

title: WebR: Why, What, How
text:
How does WebR work?

Browsers include WebAssembly and JavaScript
Webpages use Javascript to execute WebR scripts
Results are returned within a <div>

Special R canvas called HTML

title: WebR: Why, What, How
text: An Endless Loop (kind of)

title: WebR: Why, What, How
text:
WebR documentation

Very technical
Specifies how to get JS to interact with WebR in a web page
Asynchronous evaluation
Made for developers

title: WebR: Why, What, How
text:
Recommended: Quarto/WebR documentation

Quarto WebR documentation

title: WebR: Why, What, How
section: You don’t have to worry about this!
text:
You don’t have to worry about this!

Quarto/WebR extension
Handles the communication between JS and WebR
Don’t worry!

title: WebR: Why, What, How
section: Next, install Quarto Extension in Project
text:
Next, install Quarto Extension in Project

In the RStudio Terminal Window:

quarto add coatless/quarto-webr
This folder will be installed in your project:
├── _extensions
│   └── coatless
│       └── webr  ## Contains a lot of JavaScript

title: WebR: Why, What, How
text:
Quarto/WebR Setup

title: "My WebR Demo"
format: revealjs
engine: knitr


Start like usual
specify engine: knitr

title: WebR: Why, What, How
text:
Quarto/WebR Setup

title: "My WebR Demo"
format: revealjs
engine: knitr
filters:                     
  - webr                     

Need to use filters with - webr option

title: WebR: Why, What, How
text:
Quarto/WebR Setup

title: "My WebR Demo"
format: revealjs
engine: knitr
filters:                         
  - webr                         
webr:                            
  packages: ['ggplot2', 'dplyr', 'palmerpenguins']

webr is where you set options, including which packages to install

title: WebR: Why, What, How
text:
A Note about Packages

Packages need to be compiled for WebAssembly

{wasm} package

Need to solve dependencies
WebR Compiled Packages

Default repository for packages (16000+ compiled, but not everything)

Using R Packages in WebR

Can install in realtime or using the webr:packages option

title: WebR: Why, What, How
text:
Quarto/WebR Block
```{webr-r}
library(palmerpenguins)
table(penguins$island)
```

title: WebR: Why, What, How
text:
Quarto/WebR Block
```{webr-r}
library(palmerpenguins)
table(penguins$island)
```
This becomes:

Please enable JavaScript to experience the dynamic code cell content on this page.

title: WebR: Why, What, How
text:
context: setup
context: setup - Pre-load data, load packages, for use globally
```{webr-r}
#| context: setup

library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
library(penguins)
```

title: WebR: Why, What, How
text:
context: output
Show only output, not execution cell
```{webr-r}
#| context: output

table(penguins$species)
```

title: WebR: Why, What, How
text:
What about files?

There is a filesystem that is created

emscripten webassembly filesystem

Not super easy to get stuff in
Distinct from your project

can’t see anything in your directory

title: WebR: Why, What, How
text:
Deployment

You will need a web server to deploy your WebR page
Do not need a Shiny server, just something that serves HTML
Remember, all computations are done in the browser

title: WebR: Why, What, How
text:
Deployment

Can use github pages:
quarto publish gh-pages ./
Netlify
quarto publish netlify ./

title: WebR: Why, What, How
text:
Deployment
Or netlify:
quarto publish netlify ./

title: WebR: Why, What, How
text:

title: WebR: Why, What, How
text:
WebR Worker

WebR launches a worker process in browser
Uses JavaScript to communicate between web page and worker
Everything is run in the browser
